etymology.description: 言(言) (yán, "words, to speak") + 八(八) (bā, "breath coming from the mouth; divide") + 厃(厃) (wěi, "danger") -> speak too much
etymology.interpretation: The character 詹(詹) (zhān, "prolong") is formed by combining elements related to speech and excessive verbal expression, signifying the act of prolonging speech to a potentially harmful extent.

parts.english: breath coming from the mouth; divide

examples.chinese: 他詹了会议时间(他詹了會議時間)。
她决定詹了故事的结尾(她決定詹了故事的結尾)，使情节更加曲折(使情節更加曲折)。
examples.pinyin: Tā juédìng zhān le gùshì de jiéwěi, shǐ qíngjié gèngjiā qūzhé.
examples.english: She decided to prolong the ending of the story to make the plot more twisty.

examples.chinese: 裁判决定詹比赛暂停时间(裁判決定詹比賽暫停時間)。
examples.pinyin: Cáipàn juédìng zhān bǐsài zhàntíng shíjiān.
examples.english: The referee decided to prolong the match's break time.
